search.query: | rest splunk_server_group="$group$" splunk_server_group=dmc_group_search_head /services/shcluster/captain/info | dedup peer_scheme_host_port | fields label

b.span: 1.) Are searches being skipped or deferred

search.query: index=_internal source=*scheduler.log search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" $filter$ (status=delegated_remote_error OR status=completed OR status=skipped OR status=deferred) | chart count sparkline(count, 1m) as trend by status | sort -count

html.p: Click on any row above to see timechart.

panel.title: Log events reporting the following status: $s1$

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` source=*scheduler.log search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" $filter$ status="$s1$" | timechart span=1m count by status usenull=f limit=0

b.span: 2.) Why are searches being skipped or deferred

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` source=*scheduler.log search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" (status=delegated_remote_error OR status=completed OR status=skipped OR status=deferred) $filter$ | dedup reason | table reason

`dmc_set_index_internal` source=*scheduler.log search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" (status=delegated_remote_error OR status=completed OR status=skipped OR status=deferred) $filter$ reason="$reason$" | chart count sparkline(count, 1m) as trend by reason | sort -count

html.p: Click reason above to see timechart.

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` source=*scheduler.log search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error $filter$ reason="$s2$" | timechart limit=0 count by reason usenull=f

html.p: Click reason to see more details.

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` source=*scheduler.log search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error $filter$ reason="$r1$" | timechart count by savedsearch_name limit=0 usenull=f

html.p: Click search name to see more details.

table.title: runtime vs cron schedule (how long does it take to run this search vs how often are we running it) SEARCH: $r2$

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=$captain_name$ | where is_scheduled=1 | search disabled=0 | stats count by title next_scheduled_time cron_schedule schedule_priority schedule_window dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time| fields title next_scheduled_time cron_schedule schedule_priority schedule_window dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time| rename title as savedsearch_name | search savedsearch_name="$r2$" | join savedsearch_name [search index=_internal source=*scheduler.log* search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error reason=* savedsearch_name="$r2$"] | join savedsearch_name [search index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" sourcetype=scheduler status=* savedsearch_name="$r2$" dispatch_time=* | eval runtime_delay= (dispatch_time-scheduled_time) | stats avg(runtime_delay) as avg_runtime_delay max(runtime_delay) as max_runtime_delay avg(run_time) as avg_runtime max(run_time) as max_runtime by savedsearch_name | eval avg_runtime_delay=round(avg_runtime_delay,0) | eval max_runtime_delay=round(max_runtime_delay,0)| eval avg_runtime=round(avg_runtime,0) | eval max_runtime=round(max_runtime,0)| rename avg_runtime_delay as "avg_delay(sec)" max_runtime_delay as "max_delay(sec)" avg_runtime as avg_runtime(sec) max_runtime as max_runtime(sec) | sort - "max_runtime(sec)"] | table savedsearch_name status reason avg_runtime(sec) max_runtime(sec) "avg_delay(sec)" "max_delay(sec)" cron_schedule | sort -max_runtime(sec)

b.span: 3.) Which searches are being skipped or deferred

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` earliest=$time.earliest$ latest=$time.latest$ source=*scheduler.log search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error $filter$ | dedup savedsearch_name | table savedsearch_name

`dmc_set_index_internal` source=*scheduler.log search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error $filter$ $ss_name$ | chart count sparkline(count, 1m) as trend by savedsearch_name | sort -count

chart.title: reasons $s3$ has been skipped or deferred

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` source=*scheduler.log search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error savedsearch_name="$s3$" $filter$ | timechart count by reason limit=0 usenull=f

chart.title: $s3$ has been skipped or deferred for the following scheduled times

search.query: index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* $filter$ savedsearch_name="$s3$" | eval delay=(dispatch_time-scheduled_time) | join savedsearch_name [search index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error $filter$ savedsearch_name="$s3$" | dedup savedsearch_name | table savedsearch_name] | stats count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time status | stats list(status) as status list(count) as count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time | sort +scheduled_time | search status!=completed | search status!=success | search status!=delegated_remote | search status!=delegated_remote_completion | eval _time=scheduled_time | timechart span=1m count by status limit=0 usenull=f

panel.title: $s3$ has been skipped or deferred past its scheduled_time for the scheduled times listed below.

search.query: index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* $filter$ savedsearch_name="$s3$" | eval delay=(dispatch_time-scheduled_time) | convert ctime(scheduled_time) as scheduled_time | convert ctime(dispatch_time) as dispatch_time | join savedsearch_name [search index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error $filter$ savedsearch_name="$s3$" | dedup savedsearch_name | table savedsearch_name] | stats count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time status | stats list(status) as status list(count) as count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time | sort +scheduled_time | search status!=completed | search status!=success | search status!="delegated_remote" | search status!="delegated_remote_completion" | stats list(scheduled_time) as scheduled_time by savedsearch_name status | eval scheduler_action = case(status == "skipped", "scheduler will not attempt to re-run these searches for the scheduled_time",status == "delayed", "scheduler will retry to run the search up until the next scheduled_time",status == "deferred", "scheduler will attempt to re-run these searches for their scheduled_time at a future point in time",status == "delegated_remote_error", "scheduler will retry once to delgate, if still fails no further attempt") | table savedsearch_name status scheduler_action scheduled_time

panel.title: status by scheduled_time for the last $time.earliest$

search.query: index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* $filter$ savedsearch_name="$s3$" | eval delay=(dispatch_time-scheduled_time) | convert ctime(scheduled_time) as scheduled_time | convert ctime(dispatch_time) as dispatch_time | join savedsearch_name [search index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error $filter$ savedsearch_name="$s3$" | dedup savedsearch_name | table savedsearch_name] | stats count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time status | stats list(status) as status list(count) as count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time | sort +scheduled_time

panel.title: audit log for completed run times for $s3$

search.query: index=_audit search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*audittrail* action=search info=completed $filter$ savedsearch_name="$s3$" search_id!=*rsa_* | convert ctime(exec_time) as exec_time ctime(api_et) as api_et ctime(api_lt) as api_lt ctime(search_et) as search_et ctime(search_lt) as search_lt | dedup savedsearch_name search_id | table host savedsearch_name search_id total_run_time exec_time search_et search_lt result_count | sort +exec_time| fillnull search_lt value="now"

panel.title: Latency for completed run times for : $s3$

table.title: Latency is the difference between scheduled and dispatch time

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" sourcetype=scheduler status="completed" $filter$ savedsearch_name="$s3$" | eval window_time = if(isnotnull(window_time), window_time, 0) | eval execution_latency = max(dispatch_time - (scheduled_time + window_time), 0) | stats max(execution_latency) as "latency seconds" by scheduled_time dispatch_time | convert ctime(scheduled_time) as scheduled_time ctime(dispatch_time) as dispatch_time

`dmc_set_index_internal` search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" sourcetype=scheduler status="completed" $filter$ savedsearch_name="$s3$" | eval window_time = if(isnotnull(window_time), window_time, 0) | eval execution_latency = max(dispatch_time - (scheduled_time + window_time), 0) | eval _time=scheduled_time | timechart span=1m max(execution_latency) as "latency seconds"

index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* $filter$ savedsearch_name=* | eval delay=(dispatch_time-scheduled_time) | convert ctime(scheduled_time) as scheduled_time | convert ctime(dispatch_time) as dispatch_time | join savedsearch_name [search index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* $filter$ status=skipped OR status=continued OR status=deferred OR status=delegated_remote_error savedsearch_name=* | table savedsearch_name] | stats count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time status | stats list(status) as status list(count) as count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time | sort +scheduled_time | search status!=completed |search status!=success |search status!=delegated_remote |search status!=delegated_remote_completion | stats dc(savedsearch_name) as "unique searches impacted" by status | sort -"unique searches impacted"

html.p: Click on status to see impacted searches and for which scheduled_time

panel.title: Scheduled searches that have been $s4$ for their scheduled time listed below.

search.query: index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* savedsearch_name=* $filter$ | eval delay=(dispatch_time-scheduled_time) | convert ctime(scheduled_time) as scheduled_time | convert ctime(dispatch_time) as dispatch_time | join savedsearch_name [search index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* status="$s4$" savedsearch_name=* $filter$ | dedup savedsearch_name | table savedsearch_name] | stats count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time status | stats list(status) as status list(count) as count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time | sort +scheduled_time | search status!=completed |search status!=success |search status!=delegated_remote |search status!=delegated_remote_completion | stats list(scheduled_time) by savedsearch_name status | rename list(scheduled_time) as "scheduled time for which search was $s4$"| eval scheduler_action = case(status == "skipped", "scheduler will not attempt to re-run these searches for the scheduled_time",status == "delayed", "scheduler will retry to run the search up until the next scheduled_time",status == "deferred", "scheduler will attempt to re-run these searches for their scheduled_time at a future point in time",status == "delegated_remote_error", "scheduler will retry once to delgate, if still fails no further attempt") | table savedsearch_name status scheduler_action "scheduled time for which search was $s4$" | search status="$s4$"

html.p: Click savedsearch name above to see timechart.

chart.title: searches which did not complete for a given scheduled_time

search.query: index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* $filter$ status="$s4$" | join savedsearch_name [search index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" source=*scheduler.log* $filter$ status="$s4$" | dedup savedsearch_name | table savedsearch_name] | stats count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time status | stats list(status) as status list(count) as count by savedsearch_name scheduled_time | sort +scheduled_time | search status!=completed |search status!=success |search status!=delegated_remote |search status!=delegated_remote_completion |search savedsearch_name="$s6$" | eval _time=scheduled_time | timechart count by status limit=0 usenull=f

html.a: continue investigation by looking at SHC status and configurations
